sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has changed his country's legislation to allow convicted criminals to be conscripted into his country's army once released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Germanist foreign minister says Vladimir Putin is the only one who can end the war as G7 ministers pledge continued support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of believers attended a mass conducted by Pope Francis during his first ever visit to Bahrain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Released convicts in Russia can now be conscripted to fight in Ukraine, according to a recent change to the country's legislation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This, as President Vladimir Putin praised this country's mobilization. While speaking to volunteers, he said, out of 300,000 recruits, we already have 318,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Why 318,000? Because volunteers are signing up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The number of volunteers is not going down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Putin also repeated an unfounded claim that some in Poland aspire to annex part of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He made the accusation while speaking in front of like-minded civil and religious leaders and did not give any evidence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Warsaw has repeatedly denied the claim as misinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: German Foreign Minister Anna Baerbock said on Friday that Vladimir Putin alone can end the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: She was attending a meeting of G7 ministers in Munster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The seven rich nations also said they are working to implement a Russian oil price cap aimed at depriving Moscow of a key source of cash to fund its war. They have pledged continuing support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Dmytro Kuleba, my Ukrainian foreign minister colleague, who's also become a friend, was very clear yesterday about what Ukrainians need.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That's why we're putting together packages for the winter period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're supplying generators, heaters, housing containers, sewage treatment plants, water pumps and sanitary installations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The G7 ministers also called on oil producing states to increase production to help bring down prices, a month after OPEC Plus decided to drastically reduce its output.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hundreds crowded into a cathedral in Bahrain

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: to listen to a mass conducted by Pope Francis during his visit to the island nation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Bahrain, unlike its neighbor Saudi Arabia, allows Christians and Jews to exercise their faith publicly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It houses an estimated 80,000 Christians, most of whom are workers from southern Asia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Francis is on a four-day trip to Bahrain, the main aim of which is to participate in a government-sponsored interfaith conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But he will also spend part of his first-ever visit to the country, ministering to its Catholic community.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On the other side of Bahrain, protesters marched in the streets calling for political openness and rights in a country that is a de facto dictatorship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: During his visit, Francis called for the country to abolish the death penalty and for basic rights to be guaranteed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Over a thousand demonstrators gathered at the headquarters of Hungary's public media company

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: to protest what they say is biased news coverage and state-sponsored propaganda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The demonstration, dubbed a blockade of the factory of lies, also called for better coverage of a recent wave of protests by Hungarian teachers and students, calling for better pay and working conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Thousands of demonstrators gathered in the Tunisian city of Zarziz to demand information about the 12 people who disappeared at sea a month and a half ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Tunisia is a key departure point for people trying to cross the Mediterranean to Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: According to local officials, over 10,000 migrants have made the crossing this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The United States and its allies clashed with China and Russia at the UN Security Council

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: on Friday over how to respond to North Korea's recent ballistic missile launches.
